courseWork.title: OUTLINE
courseWork.description: Create a sentence outline of your final paper.
courseWork.descriptionHtml: Create a sentence outline of your final paper.

courseWork.title: FINAL REQUIREMENT - TERM PAPER
courseWork.description:
SCIENCE 10 (CHEMISTRY)

FINAL REQUIREMENT

Choose a chemical compound that is related to your major or that you are interested in. 
Write a descriptive or narrative paper about the compound and its characteristics. 

The paper should contain the following parts:

Background (Origins and Discovery)

This part of the paper should tackle the origins and discovery of the compound, specifically who, where, when, and how was this compound discovered or created.

Utilization (Abundance in Nature and Society)

This part of the paper should discuss where the compound is mostly found and used in our society, it’s natural and/or synthetic forms, and how this compound is utilized.

Significance (Importance in the present)
This part of the paper should talk about the importance of this compound in the society may it be terms of biological, economical, industrial applications. Also, how it is important or significant to you.

Key Issues (Toxicity, Sustainability, Affordability, etc.)

This part of the paper should discuss the problems associated with the compound. These issues may be about but not limited to toxicity, sustainability, and affordability.

Conclusions (Reflection)

This part of the paper should contain your opinion about the compound discussed, be it positive or negative, and should reflect the information discussed above. 

FORMAT

The body of the paper shall be at least 10 pages long, double spaced, font size 12, on an A4 size paper with 1-inch margins around, you can also opt to hand write the paper, and submit it as a PDF. Submissions through Google Classroom will only be accepted. If you have any questions, please e-mail me at jbsinapuelas@up.edu.ph. 

CRITERIA 
You will be graded based on the following criteria:

1. Knowledge – 30 points
2. Organization – 30 points
3. Synthesis – 40 points

For a total of 100 points.
